intro: Nonea lutea, commonly known as the yellow nonea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Nonea lutea is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
